title: Football quiz: name the missing club in these playing careers | Football | The Guardian

organizations.name: boca juniors real madrid leicester city
leyton orient lyon marseille paris saint-germain

text: Thursday 16 February 2017 12.45 GMT Last modified on Thursday 16 February 2017 12.47 GMT Diego Maradona: Argentinos Juniors, Boca Juniors, Barcelona, Napoli, ****, Newell’s Old Boys, Boca Juniors Real Madrid Leicester City Sevilla Maradona joined Sevilla after he had served a 15-month ban for testing positive for cocaine. New York Cosmos Ray Wilkins: Chelsea, Manchester United, Milan, ****, Rangers, QPR, Crystal Palace, QPR, Wycombe, Hibs, Millwall, Leyton Orient Lyon Marseille Paris Saint-Germain Wilkins joined the club in 1987 – just 17 years after the club had been formed. He was older than they were. Monaco Peter Beardsley: Carlisle, Vancouver Whitecaps, Manchester United, Vancouver Whitecaps, Newcastle, Liverpool, ****, Newcastle, Bolton, Fulham, Hartlepool, Melbourne Knights Portsmouth Tottenham Everton Only seven players have left Liverpool for Everton since the second world war. Beardsley did it in 1991 and only Gary Ablett, who followed in 1992, has done it since. Manchester City Pep Guardiola: Barcelona, Brescia, ****, Brescia, Al-Ahli, Sinaloa Juventus Roma Fabio Capello didn't really want to sign Guardiola and only started him twice before moving him on to Brescia. 'He was a very well-behaved player,' said Capello. 'He never asked me explanations as to why he didn't play.' Bayern Munich David Platt: Crewe, Aston Villa, Bari, ****, Sampdoria, Arsenal, Nottingham Forest Milan
